evs.utilities.mathutil
Class EmpiricalCDFCalculator

java.lang.Object
  evs.utilities.mathutil.EmpiricalCDFCalculator

public class EmpiricalCDFCalculator
extends java.lang.Object

Utility class for empirical probability distributions.

Author:
evs@hydrosolved.com

getPerc

public static double getPerc(double[] vals,
                             double val,
                             double ignore,
                             boolean sort)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Returns the percentile position of a value in an array, which may be ordered or unordered (specify). Throws an exception if all values are equal to the ignore value.

Parameters:
vals - the values
val - the value for which a percentile is required
ignore - a value to ignore
sort - is true to sort the array, false if the input values are already sorted
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

getProb

public static double getProb(double[] vals,
                             double val,
                             double ignore,
                             boolean sort)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Returns the cumulative probabilistic position of a value in an array, which may be ordered or unordered (specify). Throws an exception if all values are equal to the ignore value.

Parameters:
vals - the values
val - the value for which a probability is required
ignore - a value to ignore
sort - is true to sort the array, false if the input values are already sorted
Returns:
the probability
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

getVal

public static double getVal(double[] vals,
                            double prob,
                            double nV,
                            boolean sort)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Returns the value in an array corresponding to a given cumulative probability. The array may be ordered or unordered (specify). Throws an exception if all values are equal to the ignore value or the probability is invalid. Returns the ignore value if fewer than two valid, non-null, entries are available. Note that the lowermost and uppermost values in the array are returned for probabilities 0.0 and 1.0, respectively.

Parameters:
vals - the values
prob - the probability for which a value is required
nV - a null value to ignore
sort - is true to sort the array, false if the input values are already sorted
Returns:
the value corresponding to the probability
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

getRawEmpiricalCDF

public static double[][] getRawEmpiricalCDF(double[] vals,
                                            double nV,
                                            boolean sort)
                                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Returns the raw empirical cdf from the input whereby a probability is assigned to each non-null data value arranged in ascending order. Unlike getRawEmpiricalCDF(double[], double, boolean) tied values are not explicitly handled and the cdf is not filtered using filterCDF(double[][]) to remove steps.

Parameters:
vals - the values
nV - a null value to ignore
sort - is true to sort the array, false if the input values are already sorted
Returns:
the raw empirical CDF with probabilities in the first row
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

getCumProbsFromCumCounts

public static double[] getCumProbsFromCumCounts(double[] counts,
                                                boolean overwrite)
Returns a set of cumulative probabilities from cumulative counts.

Parameters:
counts - the counts
overwrite - is true to overwrite
Returns:
cumulative probabilities

getEmpiricalCDF

public static double[][] getEmpiricalCDF(double[] samples,
                                         double[] thresh,
                                         double ignore,
                                         boolean pThresh,
                                         boolean filter,
                                         boolean weibull)
                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Returns an empirical cdf with the cumulative probabilities in the first row and the values in the second row using the specified thresholds as input. The thresholds may be defined in terms of probabilities or real values.

Parameters:
samples - the input data
thresh - the cumulative probability thresholds
ignore - a number to ignore
pThresh - is true if the thresholds are probabilities
filter - is true to reduce stepped elements to the first and last points defining that step
weibull - is true for unbiased estimates of probability (n+1 as denominator)
Returns:
a cdf
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

getEmpiricalCDF

public static double[][] getEmpiricalCDF(double[] obs,
                                         double nV,
                                         boolean weibull)
                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Returns an empirical cdf with thresholds corresponding to the data values provided. Ranks the observations and tied ranks are given the average of the intermediate positions. The probability is then given by the Weibull plotting position (divide by n+1) if requested, otherwise no plotting position (divide by n).

Parameters:
obs - the observations
nV - the null value
weibull - is true to use the Weibull plotting position, false for no plotting position
Returns:
the empirical cdf
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

filterCDF

public static double[][] filterCDF(double[][] empiricalCDF)
Removes redundant (repeated pairs of) values from a cdf.

Parameters:
empiricalCDF - the empirical cdf
Returns:
the filtered cdf

getProbFromCDF

public static double getProbFromCDF(double[][] empiricalCDF,
                                    double x)
Returns the (cumulative) probability that a value is less than or equal to the input value given an empirical cdf whose cumulative probabilities are defined in the first row and whose corresponding values are defined in the second row.

Parameters:
empiricalCDF - the empirical cdf
x - the upper limit
Returns:
the empirical cumulative probability

getValFromCDF

public static double getValFromCDF(double[][] empiricalCDF,
                                   double prob)
Returns the value corresponding to a given probability for an empirical cdf whose cumulative probabilities are defined in the first row and whose corresponding values are defined in the second row.

Parameters:
empiricalCDF - the empirical cdf
prob - the probability
Returns:
the corresponding value

getPDFFromCDF

public static double[][] getPDFFromCDF(double[][] cdf)
Converts a cdf to a pdf

Parameters:
cdf - the cdf with probabilities in the first row
Returns:
a pdf

getIntegral

public static double getIntegral(double[][] input)
Returns the integral of an empirical function from its minimum to its maximum. The empirical function should be described in two rows.

Parameters:
input - the empirical function
Returns:
the integral
